155 years ago, word finally spread to Texas that slavery as they knew it had ended.

1273959827019087873.text: This bill is an important step towards creating a system built on fairness and justice for Black Americans, and all Americans. I look forward to working with my colleagues in the Senate to reach a bipartisan deal.

1273959825521676288.text: Let me be clear: The Justice in Policing Act does not defund the police, but rather holds law enforcement accountable while improving community services and programs that have been neglected for decades.

1273959824301215744.text: Most importantly, the Justice in Policing Act will help communities reimagine public safety by investing in mental health & homeless services, rehabilitation, & vital programs, while helping local police focus on work we really need them for, which is keeping our streets safe.

1273959823554613248.text: This Justice in Policing Act would create a system of accountability and transparency in law enforcement and eliminate harmful practices like chokeholds and no-knock warrants.

1273959822958960641.text: While our local law enforcement agencies have taken important steps to build community trust and reform their use of force guidelines, there is definitely a need to do more to ensure transparency and accountability in policing from the federal level.

1273959820161400833.text: In recent weeks, I’ve spoken with leaders in the Black community, activists, and law enforcement about the right ways to fix our criminal justice system and improve policing:

1273959819280605185.text:
I’m supporting the Justice in Policing Act. Here’s why:

For weeks, Americans have taken to the streets to voice what Black communities have been saying for decades, which is that our criminal justice system is stacked against Black Americans-something that’s undeniably true. 1/
